title: Should we use thank you in a formal letter? - Quora

response.answer_text: There's absolutely nothing wrong with using the phrase "thank you" in a formal letter. While the expression is often used informally, it's perfectly possible to make it sound very formal. For example: "I enclose my CV, and thank you for your consideration." -- "I wanted to write to thank you for giving me the opportunity ..." -- "I note that you have now returned the paperwork I requested; thank you." -- etc.
